Disease.Name: TRIMETHYLAMINURIA (FMO3)
Disease.Summary: rare;autosomal recessive;1) primary genetic form, ;2) acquired form, ;3) childhood forms, ;4) transient form associated with menstruation, ;5) precursor overload and ;6) disease states [Cashman, JR et al. 2003];The primary genetic form causes decreased FMO3 activity, and a secondary form is due to TMA or to TMA-precursor overload [Kim JH 2017]

symtomp.category: IMMUNE OR HEMATOLOGIC SYSTEM | LABORATORY FINDINGS

symtomp.symptom: behavior, self-mutilating or destructive / behaviour, self-mutilating or destructive
fishy body odor, rotting fish odor

symtomp.category: GENERAL TOPICS | IMMUNE OR HEMATOLOGIC SYSTEM

symtomp.symptom: MRS, brain, abnormalities / Magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS)

symtomp.category: IMMUNE OR HEMATOLOGIC SYSTEM | LABORATORY FINDINGS

symtomp.symptom: no clinical symptoms (probably) / no clinical significance
